definition: friends despite the difference in age
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: He inspires me and becomes a good friend of mine.
sentences.chinese: 他成了我的忘年交也为我带来启发。

sentences.english: It is, however, possible for "friendship regardless of ages".
Despite their age difference, Richard and Monica begin dating.
sentences.chinese: 莫妮卡和理查医生不顾世俗压力开始忘年交。

sentences.english: The student and the elderly professor became friends despite their age difference.
sentences.chinese: 这位学生和老教授成了忘年交。

sentences.english: He is a friend and children.

definition: not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
to get to know each other/acquaintance
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
